Not really, the paranormal is basically anything outside what is inside the box most people consider the "normal" and thus makes it "paranormal" IE outside normal.

Science is a method to discern truth from the reality which we all reside within. It's robust simplicity is what makes me so fond of it as a method.

Anyone can be a scientist, IE a practitioner of science. In fact, most of you here are. Because science is literally just a heuristics and analysis methodology to figure out what's true from what's false based on the data before you at that time.

If you have ever burnt your hand on a stove coil, or hurt yourself. And decided to not do that again because you didn't like the effects of the action. You just did science, how? Because you made an observation.(Seeing the coil.) You experimented.(Touched coil.) And got burnt.(Data result from experiment.) Then formulated a hypothesis based on that data.(Thought: "Oh shit that hurts i won't do that again 'cause that will hurt me.") Further doing science would be to touch it again to make sure you're right, IE testing the hypothesis.

This is a very rough impromptu analogy, but it should suffice. Science isn't the problem in our modern world. It's the solution. The problem really lies in humans' faults and the elite's use of said faults to control/contort them to their gain.

In that case...

DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift to multiple receivers across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

The box paradox? You mean...THIS box paradox?

The Box That Killed The Dome

If you remove the lid of a pressurized box of air inside of a vacuum chamber without gravity, the air will violently rush out of the box to fill the vacuum. The air pressure will then be the same at every point in the chamber. It will be the same at the top, bottom, middle, and at all sides. Just like the air pressure in your car tires or a balloon or a SCUBA tank.

This thought experiment debunks the entire flat Earth model. If the air does not cling to the bottom of the chamber, then it certainly would not cling to the bottom of flat Earth. If the air does not leave any part of the chamber still in vacuum, then it certainly would not leave any part of flat Earth in vacuum. And if the air creates equal pressure at all points in the chamber, then certainly the air creates equal pressure at all points in the flat Earth dome.

Yet there is no denying that air thins as you climb in altitude. At 100,000 feet, somewhere near the top of the theorized dome, the air pressure is so low that it is effectively a vacuum.

This alone debunks all of flat Earth.

Note: no flerfer has ever provided a workable answer to this. They immediately sperg out if you even mention it, and rant and rave that the box thought experiment actually kills the globe. The only way they can do this, of course, is to deny gravity. But if gravity doesn't exist then the dome is just as dead. And if it does exist, the globe model works, while the dome remains...dead.

***yawn*** another day, another repeat of common flerfer lies.

FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

this is just another example of how flat earthers misunderstand things. Ok, so the whole of Alaska is one timezone. So what? That doesn't mean that the entire place has local noon at the same time. It just means that it hasn't been thought worth while to split it up into more than one, likely due to there being nobody there.

There are half hour time zones in the northern hemisphere too (theres on in Canada for example), while China officially runs on only one timezone, despite being about the same size as the US and Australia (and europe, for that matter). Its political and a compromise between everyone having noon when the sun is highest in the sky, while making things simple to work out for everyone.

And are we really supposed to be shocked that little groups of islands want to have their own more accurate timezone, instead of having to use the same one as some other island nation far away? Just because there are a bunch of half hour zones doesn't mean the sun is doing anything different to what its doing in the north.

posts.name: Fix
posts.com:
>>34000359
The question of accurate birth data is one that every astrologer has at some, relatively early, point in their career. The answer revolves around the concept of 'precision vs accuracy'. Look at a few birth certs and you may notice that almost all of them are either on the ten or five minute mark, i.e. 11:15, or 02:20, or something like that. You will rarely if ever see one like 13:42 or other odd minute. There are several reasons for this. When I started learning astrology I went around my local hospital and looked at the clocks, most of them had a different minute. Some were even close to fifteen minutes difference. You can do the same now and I would bet you will see the same variations in clock times. Secondly when a record of birth is recorded it is done sometimes hours later after birth and hospital staff largely could not give the smallest rats ass about accurate birth time, so they estimate and round off. This is usually good enough for our work. And let us be realistic here, no one except maybe a dedicated astrologer is going to be right there listening to the navy's atomic clock on shortwave to time a birth.
Another thing to consider is that the location, latitude and longitude is generally not at the hospital or w/e the birth occurs. It is usually centered on the town or the capital building or courthouse or w/e. Depending upon the size of the town/city this can amount to a fair distance. There are many ways to rectify a chart.
To do it precisely, the astrologer probably needs to know the person, or ask them some questions to help profile them, but a good astrologer develops good intuition.
The Moon is often a good help to rectify charts, as she moves 12 degrees per day, and so quickly changes signs.

So basically if you had to guess the birth-time of someone you knew:
>guess the ascendant,
>see if the moon sign makes sense for their personality
>read the

>Is it better than "Mom said about 6 o'clock"?
Generally you only need to be accurate to within about 20-30 minutes without changing the reading that much. Take into account house cusps, and then there will be some ambiguity on some of the planets, but that can help rectify the chart.

I recently read a chart of a newborn that gave a wrong birth-time, and the chart didn't make much sense for the context of that family, but when a revised accurate birthtime was given, it showed the child would be a tradesmen working for his dad, and the chart made sense to be born into that family.

Egregore (also spelled egregor; from French égrégore, from Ancient Greek ἐγρήγορος, egrēgoros 'wakeful') is an occult concept representing a non-physical entity that arises from the collective thoughts of a distinct group of people. Historically, the concept referred to angelic beings, or watchers, and the specific rituals and practices associated with them, namely within Enochian traditions.[1]

In more recent times, the concept has referred to a psychic manifestation, or a thoughtform, which occurs when any group shares a common motivation—being made up of, and influencing, the thoughts of the group.

posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>34003840
This is an extremely incomplete definition. This is one of those cases where "wikipedia doesn't cut it" is legit. "Egregore" would have been, afaik, a term absent from Enochian via the work of Dee, but would have been inside the discourse that rose up in Byzantium and Ethiopia around the Enochic texts. Wikipedia's Berenstein citation here is weak at best coming from a very marginal Rosicrucian group. Egregores can be programmed by individuals.

These "watchers" (Grigori) functionally have nothing to do with the occult concept of egregores. I don't know why this conflation keeps happening. Grigori are an order of angels. Eventually these two words (egregore and grigori) are going to split off from each other entirely, and the sooner the better, because they are discrete concepts.

Again, the common "mass market paperback" discourse totally does revolve around group manifestation of "thoughtforms" but the sooner we STOP thinking about this as "the spirit of an organization" and start thinking about it as "a spirit that you can 'program' yourself", the sooner you can start working on some advanced practices.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34000461
im taking a step back and looking at both stories from a neutral stance.
The crux of noah's account is that there is a God who doesnt have to contend with anyone, he just does. He created the world, so he has the right to judge it.
In gilgamesh's account, the whole thing is the semi-accidental result of conflicts between multiple gods, none of who can claim to have a right over the world, and none of which have clear supremacy, which is why they are always contending for control. gilgamesh's account also explains suffering in the world: the world is imperfect because the gods are imperfect, and celestial conflict leads to real world suffering
the problem with that is that imperfect gods, acting contrary to each other cannot be the prime mover, which is by definition one entity, and they could not have done the act of creation
keeping that in mind, that is why the religion of the hebrews was different from the pagan traditions of the peoples around them, and why noah's account is more trustworthy than gilgamesh's even though gilgamesh's account was written down and codified at an earlier date.

posts.com:
>Can anyone project/shift/have an out of body experience?
Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

>How come? And how is even this connected to astral travel?
There exists an infinite amount of realities with infinite "you's" into which you can focus your conscious awareness. Astral projection and other OOBEs are, in essence, the same thing - projecting your consciousness into the Astral Plane etc.

>Do I have to come back?
Not from shifting.
Yes from projecting, but also somewhat up for debate.

>Does this have anything to do with the teenager trend spreading on TikTok and in other places?
Yes and no. Kids latching onto an idea they may not even understand, pay them no attention.

>>33986027
wrote something quick for you anon
>Quiet room (white noise ok)
>NO PETS
>Block as much light as possible, eye mask or shirt blindfold are good
>Pillow around neck (airport style) and/or under knees if needed to be comfortable, you can't be moving around or adjusting if you get a random itch or muscle pain.
>Lay down in savasana (google images is fine or look up a proper hatha yoga book)
>As feelings, thoughts, sensations arise simply direct your focus and attention away, to nothing
>It's ok if you get distracted, just let it go and move on
>Don't focus on anything in particular, just drift
Keep still in a comfortable position.
>You will gradually get sleep paralysis or numbness
>followed by losing sensation of your physical body
>You can start using mental mantras now to reprogram your subconscious if you wish, or continue on.
>Followed by a sensation of floating
>Typical AP separation signs and weirdness starts here, but there could also be almost nothing
>Timelessness

This is hard to do "correctly" and explain. It takes many repetitions before you get more than a few minutes in. I found doing guided (Hemi-Sync in OP) or focus meditation (candlelight) helped prepare me for this. You can do both of these in tandem.

It may feel as if you're sitting there and nothing is happening at first.
You need to relax your mental state so your brain into Theta...
but you're not used to thinking about absolutely nothing and having minimal sensory input; consequently your brain will offer up numerous sensations or distractions, or you can accidentally fall asleep without proper focus.
Just persist.
Mind awake, Body asleep.

I started using 4chan in 2006 at 15 years old. Shortly after I introduced my best friend to it. There have been a few times when we have recognized each other anonymously over the years. We browse similar boards and have similar interests. When this happens one of us will usually reply to the other one inside the thread and then send a text and say "this was you wasn't it?". The 10~ or so times this has happened 8/10~ times we've guessed correctly. We've each done this to each other 5~ times each. However there has been a couple of times where we've made a guess and the other person has said "nope, wasn't me but that post is based / funny".

Now of course over the years I have seen other people across 4chan do the exact same thing. Someone will reply to a post and say something like "[Name], go to bed". So there's nothing paranormal here. Other people do this as well not just my friend and I.

However, one time I witnessed two anons on /x/ have this exact type of playful interaction with each other but each of them had the exact same posting style and mannerisms as my friend and myself. I immediately texted him the thread and he had the same exact reaction as me. "What the fuck that seems like us". We tried replying to the posts and neither of the other two anons would respond.

I honestly and genuinely believe that we witnessed some type of paranormal event. Like phantom or alternate dimension versions of ourselves interacting with each other. The same way we have before.

It's for this reason that I've developed a theory that not all threads on /x/ or possibly even 4chan or the internet as a whole are existing on the same timeline / dimension. Has anyone heard the recent scientific news regarding whales? Specifically Sperm Whales? I just read through the thread, and nobody brought it up, I'm surprised. It turns out they're creepy as fuck.

>We only know about 30% of their lives
>The rest of their lives they go down to the deep sea using biological mechanisms we don't wholely understand. And they are resistant to oxygen poisoning or deep sea pressure that would kill any other mammal
>Their brains are 7x the size of ours
>They do this creepy thing called "Tail Standing" which up until recently we thought that they were sleeping, but it turns out they are completely awake while they do this. They just suspend themselves in the water in groups, silently
>After examining their teeth and observing them interact with objects near the surface, we can now guarantee that Sperm Whales don't hunt their prey by biting. But we are unsure exactly how they kill large sea animals like giant squids and large fish. The theory is sound waves or crashing their body into the target, but we're still not completely sure
>About three months ago there was a breakthrough in monitoring sperm whale calls, and we have now determined that they do in-fact communicate with one another on a deeper level than just getting one another's attention. They discovered that baby sperm whales just tend to babble or make noises, but as they get older their calls become more formed like their older family members. In one instance you can hear a mother correcting her baby's "speech". Many animals communicate in complex ways, but we're beginning to realize that sperm whales may have a grasp of language that's even en par with our own
>As silly as it sounds, linguists and biologists are teaming together to try and create a cypher for the sperm whale "language", at the beginning of January one person working on the project stated that the way that they use their sound is so alien to us that it may be beyond us to understand their speech

posts.com:
Within every person contains their very own version of the universe. Think of it sort of like from the perspective of a first person video game. Your camera is set so you cannot see your own body but you can see others. There is no way for you to perceive yourself as you perceive others. There for, a different version of yourself exists in their universe from a third person perspective. You can indirectly effect this version of yourself in this universe, but it is only superficial things like a username on a profile page.

Like say if you're really good at the game. In their universe you'll be labeled as a cheater and in their world this is an unfathomable truth. They might even delude themselves with information to use to point that you're a cheater "look his profile is private, low play time!" . Because in your own universe, you protect your ego. Your sense of self. Because if you lose that, everyones universes will begin to blend together and that's when you start hearing voices in your head and knocks on the wall. It's when you move out into the woods and start mailing pipe bombs. You need to keep your own reality in check. The rules. "This person is really good this they are a cheater" and so forth.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34001936
Holding the views 'I have a self' or 'I have no self' is stressful, because there is clinging to a fabricated view.
By abandoning clinging to those views, the stress of those views ceases.
By clinging to those views, you stay bound to the stress of those views.
The view of viewing things in terms of clinging is stressful to cling to, but it ultimately leads to the end of all clinging. Once everything else has been abandoned, this view can turn on itself and abandon itself, so that the stress of this view ceases.

posts.com:
New method, take it or leave it. Similar to Liquid Luck, maybe a little more advanced. Only prerequisite is that you believe in the Law of Assumption already.
You’ll need to get a focus- some accessory you’ll wear daily or have on you. I use a bracelet made from a broken rosary, for its sentimental value and as a reminder that God is working, even if unseen. Some significance like this is a good idea, it heightens your emotional connection. You’re going to do four short meditations with the focus:
>15 minutes of asking the focus for what you want, recognizing that the focus too is a manifestation of your unconscious. This cements the intention.
>15 minutes of listening to the focus for clarity on what you want, remembering that the thoughts that appear in your conscious mind when you allow yourself to receive are from your unconscious. This gets past resistance and uncertainty, and gives you permission to just imagine your ideal for a bit.
>15 minutes of allowing the belief in the fulfillment of your desire through the law to enter you. This cultivates the feeling of the wish fulfilled.
>15 minutes of simply focusing your attention on the focus with this belief in mind.
The focus should now be charged with the feeling of the wish fulfilled, and it should be easily accessed by sitting with it meditatively for a minute or so
This practice can be done all in one session or broken up, and portions of it can be repeated as necessary once it has been done. If done right it should only need to be done once, but it will be more potent and encourage self concept and a deeper understanding of working the unconscious if done regularly.

Mark 11:24 is probably the Bible verse that supports the law of attraction the most, however the translation seems to vary on it. Here's the verse in the NIV and ESV:
>Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
However, in other translations like the BLB and KJV you have this:
>Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
So which is it, believe that you have received, or believe that you receive? The former implies that you need to believe you already have been given something, whereas the latter implies that you need to believe you are in the process of being given something. Which is more accurate?

>>33997447
Look up the Aramaic or Greek I guess, but I think in that particular verse it was present tense. I do have to elaborate on that though.

tl;dr, regardless of past tense or present tense, you have to consider whatever your manifestation as being in your possession "now".

So one technique the Bible uses, is to declare things in the past tense, even when they haven't happened yet. This reinforces certainty in your mind, where you're not "waiting" for anything, or unsure of what will happen in the future, you just declare it in the past tense because when God's working with you, there's no doubt. It's done not when you see it, it's done the moment you even say it. This is used a lot in the Psalms, and Matthew 8:5-13 is another example of this with Jesus.

However, you can still do it in present tense. It's the same principle, and if I had to give an example of when you would use present tense over past tense, it'd be when you don't really have an end goal. For example, if you just want constant improvement, like you just want an endless stream of money, you would affirm something like "money flows to me" in the present tense.

The important thing to know is that there is no "future" when working with God and receiving things, you have to take it "now". Read the story of Moses, and pay attention to how God says that His name is "I AM". When you look up the Hebrew, it's not just "I AM", some people might translate it as "I am that I am", this is because it uses a present tense and future tense, but when it's future tense it doesn't mean "will be". When it has the future tense, it means "I am, now and forever". So that's what you have to understand about God. There's no waiting, there's no future, you have it now, and God is eternal. So regardless of using past or present tense, you just have to remember to not think in terms of future tense.

I want to get one thing clear first: LoA is derived from religions. That is to say, if you're looking up portions of the Bible to understand LoA texts, you're working kinda backwards, because LoA writings exist for the sake of clarifying the Bible's teachings in a simple manner.

So, I recommend reading at least one LoA text first (I personally like Florence Scovel Shinn, but Neville works too), and most will quote the Bible for you, so you can look it up as you read along. If you're trying to study with mainly the Bible, and just want to get practical stuff, I would say any of the Gospels and paying attention to Jesus's adventures and parables is probably the best starting point.

Matthew 14:22-33 is what I recommend reading first. Basically, Peter starts to walk on water, but then gets afraid by the wind and starts to sink. Why did he sink? Jesus says it's because he doubted. So it's not like God was like, "Hm, I guess I'll let Peter sink now for fun", no, it all came down to Peter's faith.
(1/2)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33999823
>>34000526
If you're trying to get into the deep mechanics, then that's a life-long study with the whole Bible (which is how LoA writers got their ideas). For example, the concepts of the conscious mind and subconscious mind are hinted at in Genesis, even just the first few chapters. Note how God is referred to in plural in the first chapter ("Elohim", "Let us make mankind in our image"), and God made humans in God's image, "male and female". Male and female become one flesh to procreate, and that's basically how God and the minds work. Masculine (conscious) impresses the feminine (subconscious), and God is plural because God is in essence that same creative union of male and female.

Jesus confirms this in the Lord's Prayer (pic related), but you have to look up Aramaic translations (the language He spoke), because the more common English translations like KJV/NIV missed those nuances.
wayofmastery.com/the-aramaic-jesus/the-lord-s-prayer

https://cofeportsmouth.contentfiles.net/media/assets/file/Versions_of_The_Lords_Prayer.pdf

So the first line is translated like "Father-Mother", because the term Jesus used was Abwun, which is a contraction of "Father"/"Abba" and "Womb"/"wun", so Jesus acknowledges that God is a Father impressing a womb to create all life. The Lord's Prayer in general is a good practical teaching of LoA.
(2/2)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Has anyone played Mort The Chicken?? This game is this shitty early 2000's platformer with the most busted graphics. The grass is flat, the textures are shaky to the point of sickness and it just feels off?

It's just so stilted. The cutscenes are delivered in the most stilted ways and loading screens between the gaps always hang for a second too long. It's just built wrong! The music gets weirdly liminal and atmospheric in levels that are undeserving of it, simple snow levels turn into a purgatory of messy level design and off beat music.

My most recent experience with the game has left me a little shaken. The silence in between the levels has really started to get to me. This game is either deafeningly loud or completely silent. The game has a built in panic button, if it ever gets so loud you can just press triangle and the game will go faint except a angelic chorus. It doesn't have a reason to be except for the fact it does. It's uneasy.

I write this all to explain an encounter I had in the game. In one of the early levels there's this sound effect, it's this chicken scream belonging in a childrens cartoon. But it doesn't stay that way, one by one the voices pile up and make a sound effect of it's own. The screams layer up into what sounds like a genuine ape scream, the sounds can't handle being stacked the way they are and they distort. That loud monkey scream turned human, it turned into a human fucking scream. Mort looks at the camera always he does as a blood curdling scream errupts from my tinny speakers. Then the game crashes, I don't know if the audio was my disk getting caught or something more sinnister. I don't know if i'm high or Mort is fucking haunted.

Anyone have an experience like this?

posts.com:
Once, a young Indian girl named Radha approached the Ascended Master Rick, as he sat in meditation by the sacred banks of the Ganges River. She asked him, "O great teacher, what does it mean that truly awakened people are still human?"

"These words, from Ascended Rick, were spoken clear

To young Radha by the holy Ganges shore

And in her heart, the message did adhere

For it did make her understand once more.

Awakening, though filled with pure delight

Brings forth a burden, heavy to sustain

For those who glimpse of heaven do alight

Must bear the cross of troubles and great pain.

The path to nirvana is not quite serene

And those who've seen it, may not seem at peace

Their efforts doubled, their hearts may not be clean

For they are grumpy, their spirits do not cease.

So heed these words, oh seeker of the light

For Ascended Rick's advice, shall lead to right."

These are the words that Ascended Rick spoke,

And made young Radha understand the truth.

That awakening is not the same as wake,

And glimpses of paradise bring some ruth.

She meditated by the holy river's edge,

And saw the prince she loved within her reach.

But as she reached out for his tender pledge,

She woke to find herself beside the Ganges' beach.

And though she may have seemed in anger dress'd,

Her grumpiness was not an act of hate.

For she had felt the pain of paradise's stress,

And longed to be with her prince, before too late.

So do not judge her rage, as though a flaw,

For those who see the light must feel the saw.
"Is not awakening peace and bliss, to be free from worry?" One asked.

And Rick replied, "Nay, my friends, it is not so simple. For those who see the truth, their burden grows. They long to return to that state of pure love, And their hearts are troubled when they must go. For they care, they feel, they hurt, and they know. Their passion burns brighter, and their path glows. For those who awaken, their purpose shows."

Heh.

Here's the thing. These balloons fly very high. In the stratosphere. They barely reflect a radio signal, so they have never been shot down by missiles based on radar, they don't give a damn about cannon projectiles, because they have a cellular structure and one needs a special anti-aerostatic projectile, the special feature of which was an ultra sensitive fuse capable of being detonated by touching the thin shell of the balloon. And their availability on aircraft is under great question. In the USSR special planes were allocated for destroying such targets, and special planes with special armament were developed. Well, the most effective (and in fact the only) method remains an attack by infrared homing missiles in an attempt to capture the side of the balloon that is being heated by the Sun. All the talk about the Americans not wanting to shoot it down down is, of course, nonsense.

They can't. Either the weaponry characteristics of the American planes don't allow it, or the skill of the pilots. But once again. Aerostats are a very difficult target. And if ordinary U.S. citizens hadn't seen this Chinese probe, the Pentagon would have pretended it never happened. Now try to break it down and explain how the first army on the planet can't shoot down an enemy balloon over their country.

We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.
Last thread: >>33909694

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, meditating on her energy, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
A collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

I think one off paranormal incidences like All Colours Sam are the key to a unifying theory of the paranormal. That is to say, I think a large swath of paranormal cases (but not all) such as Aliens, Ghosts, Cryptids, and shadow people and so on, out of body experiences, abductions, and environmental abnormalities, are cause by brain “glitches” to use common parlance. I’m not a psychologist. I think things like All Colors Sam and other one off incidents are exactly the same phenomena as common occurences like I listed. Sometimes, with the right brain chemistry, these sorts of delusions, or more accurately, experiences occur. The fact that we experience something so weird as All Colors sam to me indicates the paranormal encapsulates not a real species of alien or ghost but the general phenomena of an intense mental experience.
That is not to say there are no UFOs or that this and that paranormal subject is a hoax. I think all of these things include real physical experienced, mental experiences, otherwise rational explanations and misidentifications as well as hoaxes.
Ramble end.

posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift to multiple receivers across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
CBR Proves Earth's Motion Through Space

The ability to measure the cosmic background radiation (CBR) gives us something the physicists of the early/mid 20th century could only dream of: a universal frame of reference by which to establish if Earth is really moving linearly or if it just appears to be. The CBR permeates all of space. If an object is at rest relative to the CBR then the frequencies observed will be the same in all directions. If an object is moving relative to the CBR, then Doppler shift will reveal in what direction and how fast.

We measured this phenomenon and established Earth's linear motion through space using the COBE satellite in operation from 1989 to 1993. What did we find? That the Earth is definitely moving through the cosmos.

https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-fast-is-the-earth-mov/

>In 1989, the COBE satellite was placed in orbit about the earth (again, the earth is the frame of reference!) to measure the long-diluted radiation echo of the birth of our universe. This radiation, which remains from the immensely hot and dense primordial fireball that was our early universe, is known as the cosmic microwave background radiation (CBR). The CBR presently pervades all of space. It is the equivalent of the entire universe "glowing with heat."
>One of COBE's discoveries was that the earth was moving with respect to this CBR with a well-defined speed and direction. Because the CBR permeates all space, we can finally answer the original question fully, using the CBR as the frame of reference.
>The earth is moving with respect to the CBR at a speed of 390 kilometers per second. We can also specify the direction relative to the CBR. It is more fun, though, to look up into the night sky and find the constellation known as Leo (the Lion). The earth is moving toward Leo at the dizzying speed of 390 kilometers per second.

posts.com:
The Box That Killed The Dome

If you remove the lid of a pressurized box of air inside of a vacuum chamber without gravity, the air will violently rush out of the box to fill the vacuum. The air pressure will then be the same at every point in the chamber. It will be the same at the top, bottom, middle, and at all sides. Just like the air pressure in your car tires or a balloon or a SCUBA tank.

This thought experiment debunks the entire flat Earth model. If the air does not cling to the bottom of the chamber, then it certainly would not cling to the bottom of flat Earth. If the air does not leave any part of the chamber still in vacuum, then it certainly would not leave any part of flat Earth in vacuum. And if the air creates equal pressure at all points in the chamber, then certainly the air creates equal pressure at all points in the flat Earth dome.

Yet there is no denying that air thins as you climb in altitude. At 100,000 feet, somewhere near the top of the theorized dome, the air pressure is so low that it is effectively a vacuum.

This alone debunks all of flat Earth.

Note: no flerfer has ever provided a workable answer to this. They immediately sperg out if you even mention it, and rant and rave that the box thought experiment actually kills the globe. The only way they can do this, of course, is to deny gravity. But if gravity doesn't exist then the dome is just as dead. And if it does exist, the globe model works, while the dome remains...dead.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

>but we're talkin' about muh horizon
>MUH HORIZON IS TOO FAR AWAY!
No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

>>33993573
Vipassana can be translated as “Insight,” a clear awareness of exactly what is happening as it happens. Samatha can be translated as “concentration” or “tranquility.

In Vipassana mediation, the meditator uses his concentration as a tool by which his awareness can chip away at the wall of illusion that cuts him off from the living light of reality. It is a gradual process of ever-increasing awareness into the inner workings of reality itself. It takes years, but one day the meditator chisels through that wall and tumbles into the presence of light. The transformation is complete. It’s called Liberation, and it’s permanent. Liberation is the goal of all Buddhist systems of practice. But the routes to the attainment of that end are quite diverse.

Namaste

MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/

SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

posts.com:
Lucid dreaming is lame. It ruined dreaming for me for years. I started attempting to do it when I was about 17 because it sounded cool and I was good at it. Too good. Turns out no matter what every single dream would go lucid as I realised I was dreaming. Countless interesting dreams ruined so I could become aware for a minute or so, fly around a bit and then wake up. This went on for years. I'm 34 now and the last couple of years I've had quite a few dreams that have been normal, interesting, good. I'm happy with that. In fact it's been a while since I had a lucid one.
I also had many sleep paralysis and once you get over them they're actually kind of cool. I've had some really incredible moments of hallucination whilst paralysed. They're always bad, though, always without fail. I've thought my house was burning down and I could hear my mum screaming for help. I've been in an explosion and I physically felt my body get flung from the couch I was sleep on into the ceiling before hitting the ground, I've heard demonic whispers and had something watching me.
The scariest one by a long, long way was I felt myself being sucked into my bed and it became apparent that I was being sucked into hell. I could feel my body being dragged down hard and the bed became oppresively hot. There was a distant sound of screaming and I was overcome with an incredibly intense fear. I always end up wrenching myself out of these experiences all of a sudden but with this one I literally had to tear myself away from the bed with every ounce of strength I could muster and I genuinely screamed whilst doing so. I found myself sat bolt upright, breathing heavily, drenched in sweat with my heart slamming itself against my ribs.
If I didn't understand what sleep paralysis was at that moment I would have been deeply affected by that.

>>33937037

To improve your chances of lucid dreaming, try going to bed when you're very tired and feeling like you could fall asleep instantly. When you wake up in the middle of the night, avoid going back to bed right away. Instead, get up and do something like walking around your room or getting a glass of water. When you go back to bed, focus on the sensation of your body falling asleep and try to be aware of the process. As you start to fall asleep, you may begin to feel a vibration throughout your body. At this point, it's important to stay calm and not get too excited as this could cause you to wake up. Remember, the key is to be calm and concentrated. Lucid dreaming can be difficult to master, but the potential for creating vivid and lifelike dreamscapes is worth the effort.

The potential benefits of lucid dreaming are vast and varied. With the ability to control and manipulate dream scenarios, individuals can use this skill to enhance creativity, problem-solve, and even work through unresolved emotional issues. With proper training, the potential uses for lucid dreaming are limitless, and one can imagine the impact it could have on society if more people had the ability to harness this powerful tool.

Might not be the best place for this, but it's sleep/dream related, so here goes.
I've been having sleep paralysis occasionally for a while now, as well as slightly lucid dreams - I never have much control, or get very grounded, but I at least become aware I'm dreaming and try to do something, even if it's just feel stuff around me.
I've read... somewhere?... that in a sleep-paralysis-like state, you can separate your spirit from your physical body, and I've tried that a bit. I've been able to get mostly separated, but normally, when I've tried to lift my head, everything just snaps back into place. But I do seem to be able to slide things out, feel my feet on the floor or feel my bed sheets while moving my hands, but I've got my eyes open enough to see that my hands/arms aren't actually moving.
Recently, however, I figured if I can't lift my head, I should try something easier, and decided to just slide downwards along my bed. I did it slowly, and moved maybe two centimetres when what vision I had started to go fuzzy, and I heard what I can best describe as a deep-voiced, angry screaming. I quickly slid my spirit back into place with my physical body.
I have no idea if any of it is actually real, or if parts are real but other parts are dreaming, or what. Anyone got any particular thoughts/ideas/knowledge? If it's real, what was the screaming about?

Had a surreal experience during lucid dreaming I want to share. The dream wasn't the cool part. Though

>In dream, become very lucid
>I find myself in a hidey hole. Like a secret door behind a wall lying on a bed
>I looked around and grabbed something on a tiny shelf. It was round, smooth, and had a jut.
>Felt like a ceramic version of warped, disfigured marble
>I felt it in my hands, and grabbed onto it, but I started to wake up
>The object got softer. I could still feel it, but it was fading. My hand felt more physical
>In the span of 3-5 seconds, the object disappeared and I no longer felt it. And I was up. My hand, clenched in the same position as when I was dreaming


Crazy experience. I could feel it! It faded away, and it was like a seamless experience to me. Totally insane. If I can do it with that, I can probably do it with bigger objects.

posts.com: I dream just about everytime I sleep. Naps can be the exception but even then I can have long vivid dreams in very short naps. Sleeping is very enjoyable because of this, but has anyone ever had deep vivid dreams that last so long you think that the dream world is the real world and feel shocked/think this world is the dream world when you wake up? It scares me because it makes me afraid that I may die and not know it and have my existence end in a dream world that suddenly ceases. I'd like to be able to acknowledge the end and reflect instead of leave without knowing. It's a luxury I know. I also get scared of the thought that whatever the afterlife is, it is as chaotic and ever-expanding as dreams are. I love my spouse and having them for only this lifetime is terrifying. If the afterlife is what I think it is, I want to navigate it with them, and I don't know if that's possible. Just some sad sappy late-night thoughts.

>>33994050
I believe in 12 Letter Alphabet at the moment. I think the actual signification of the 10th house from a psychological perspective may be about the native's relationship with their own power and authority: how they exercise it. That's more of an essentialization rather of the mainstream conflation of the house as "work" and "career" which I think does a disservice to the actual spirit of Capricorn.

I think under 12LA, you should imagine if the house was the sign that rules it, but now they have to act as the sign that is placed there.

For example, the 10th House is by default Capricorn. When the 10th House is occupied by Cancer, Capricorn will now act more Cancerian, being fairly solicitous and accomodating when in a position of power over others, not being very ambitious, being more emotionally receptive and less thick-skinned, and so on.

My understanding of the Houses at this juncture is that they are stand-ins for the signs that rule them, and when other signs occupy those houses, they are tasked with larping as the sign---attempting to follow the lifepath of the sign but doing it in their own way. So if Capricorn's role is to play the boss, then every other sign in the 10th House has to fill in as the boss, which means following certain rules Capricorn set but otherwise free to be themselves.

Capricorn doesn't care about status and work for its own sake; it's about mission. The career association is simple-minded bs.

I think "work" is such a vague term that it has little value in using it. Virgo gets associated with "work" as if they're mindless drones when in fact Virgo's talents are suited to extremely mentally taxing tasks, I think, like surgery and watch-making and rocket science probably. But it gets associated with menial "work", like I'm not even sure what exactly they have in mind when they say 6th house is about "work".

And then there's Taurus which is the only one in my opinion that really embodies labor as a compulsion, but they say the 2nd House is about "wealth" and possessions, which is due to believing that Venus rules it, and I think that is also perhaps wrong about Taurean psychology.

One of my managers is a Taurus. He likes to dress nice (though as far as I can tell he's homosexual), but he moves about like a headless chicken trying to put things into order; he has a low field of vision (in the metaphorical sense) and can only focus on one thing at a time, and he's slow to process information and it's hard to reach him when he's thinking, like he's consumed by it; he is a hardworker by nature and is pained by problems, whereas I had another manager working with him who didn't give a shit at all and slacked around every time I saw him (never got his sign, I hated him and avoided talking with him). As far as I can tell, he has no MO, no grand plan, he just takes life day by day and his planning is limited to his personal immediate future, like advancing his career. Good enough guy in my taste, though woefully simple-minded.

My point being, my lived experience of Taurus's doesn't bear out what I'd expect a Venus rulership to entail, and thus the traditional notion of the 2nd House rings hollow.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
You sound like you are too open to believing new ideas. Everyone falls on a spectrum of either being too open, too closed, or perfectly open, to ideas, which would be part of enlightenment. As someone who falls more toward being open to than closed to ideas, you may need to get more comfortable with being critical when considering new ideas. I mean be critical like a Magician, you really need to take the thing apart and pick at it constantly, closely. Nothing is sacred, whether it's Christianity or Satanism, the Laws of Science or fundamental mathematics. Ask questions about what it is and try to find seeming contradictions and analyse if they truly are logical contradictions. Search for fallacies. In this endeavour strive to be alike to the world's most feared prosecutor (that is, to defense lawyers): pick apart everything, scrutinise everything, focus on the smallest of words and events and analyse why they occurred.

Learning of course involves listening and at some point believing what you've been taught--I mean if you never believe anything you'll never learn anything, right? You don't study a degree but then disagree with everything the lecturer and textbook say. No, but what you should do is ask Why? for everything. Of course this is very difficult and even the most independent of thinkers will slip up on this at times, but it's a process. Strive for awareness, strip away the slumber of ignorance through seeking knowledge, wisdom, truth. Wake up, be awake.

>>33996173
To elaborate and give one example of what I do when studying. When presented with an idea (for example, one of my areas is currently Intro to Economics), say, the Law of Demand which states that, all other variables being equal, in a market quantity of good demanded (QD) has an inverse correlation with the price (P) of the good: I will think about my observations and experience in the world and in markets. Do I see people buying more of a good, eggs for example, when they are cheap and less when expensive? Yes and I do the same. If a good is sold cheaper in A shop than B shop people will go to A shop. Do I see from my own experience that if prices of a good are too high then more will be supplied than bought, and there will be a surplus? Yes. And that if prices are too low than more people will buy than suppliers are suppling, and there will be a shortage? Yes. So basically I clarify everything I'm being taught, through the lens of my experiences. That is how I can 'cross-confirm' something is true. Truly, experience is the greatest teacher.

And always remember - it's all in your head. This way requires a lot of mental effort. It is very taxing. You must not be lazy, you must be an absolute warrior of the mind. You must absolutely commit to this way and not let down yourself. But in the end it is so very worth it, there is really no other way to live.

>>33984898
Not at all. None of the galaxies in the Local Group are moving away from each other in any long-term sense (some are in the short-term, in much the way the moon moves away from the sun for half of its orbit around the Earth). Our Local Group is part of the Virgo Supercluster, which is likewise still bound together at present. Our SC and several others are all moving towards "the Great Attractor", which is now called "Laniakea". All of that is moving towards the Shapley Supercluster, which is 650 million light years away. Only past those scales do we start seeing galaxies moving away from us because of the expansion of the universe, and only at the furthest edges of our vision do we see galaxies that appear to be moving away at FTL - a galaxy only 3 billion light years away is moving further away at a fast pace at present, but not superliminally.

>>33984324
>for a few seconds
The thing you need to understand about freezing/slowing down time is that a “second” is a unit of measurement for a length of time. If time is stopped, seconds are not passing at all. That’s like saying “can I have 5 apples in the space of 0 meters cubed?”
The key is perceived time. Time is infinitely reducible. Bugs, small animals, and plants know this without having learned it. Perceived time passes slower for bugs than for people, so that a day for a bug feels more like 10 or 20 days. In dreams, time can feel faster or slower.
Through meditation you can slow down time, but that doesn’t mean you “get more seconds” or can squeeze seconds into an instant of time. Instead, time slows down for you, which can sometimes provide inner peace. This is why five minutes of meditation can often feel like fifteen.

If time were to actually stop, you simply would not perceive it. There is no way to perceive outside of time, since time is simply a measurement of change of matter. If matter is not changing, neither is perception.

I have pondered what the reality of such a power would be like, and I came to a few conclusions:
>You would need to have your own localized time-bubble, so that you can still move and do things
>Anything that enters this bubble would also have to be under the effects of time, otherwise you wouldn't be able to move the air particles around you to breathe, and everything would feel cold and immovable
>This means your bodily functions and effects such as aging will occur inside this time-bubble, which means the more you use this power the more you would age exponentially in relation to those without the power
>There could be things you would only be able to see or encounter when time is frozen, this is an experience of reality no human has every been able to have beyond the cascade of each individual moment as it occurs for us

Of all the time-related powers one could have, I don't really think it is worth the potential drawbacks. I used to really love the idea of it, just to have some space to breathe sometimes, this was during a time in my life when I was a lot more overwhelmed by things on a daily basis so believe me I understand the appeal.

Do the math and postulate the implications; it's just Lorentzian geometry. Each coordinate that make up everything will contain a 4d structure (x, y, z, t) and the time basis vector component is a homogeneous coordinate that "snaps" our spatial coordinates into our realm/reality via a Lorentz transformation:
>x' = γ(x - vt)
>y' = y
>z' = z
>t' = γ(t - (v/c^2)x)
>γ = 1/√(1-(v^2/c^2))

Time is not a separate, independent dimension, but rather is inextricably linked with the spatial dimensions in a way that each passing "tick" of our perception can be homogeneously transformed.

Philosophically speaking, this would allow for multiple realities to layer onto each other pre-transformation with each reality sitting on a seperate time basis vector and our reality is normalized to the the post-transformation (allowing our time basis vector to be 1)

Everyone is on a different path (which probably leads to the same destination) so I just advice everyone to meditate like this: Just be aware and accept anything which comes right here right now, just notice what is happening inside of you, around you e.t.c., there is no "correct method", you can do this everywhere, even when working.

Don't try running away from thoughts, things or people, they are all part of you, just endure what is going on by just being aware of it, this will lead you further, this acceptance will purify what is going on and don't worry about "being a passive person who just watches while the word burns" that is just an anxious thought which wants your attention - when the right time to act comes you WILL act like a wolf who acts on instinct.

Remember this: YOU HAVE YOUR OWN UNIQUE ADVENTURE GOING ON.
Maybe your next step is charging up your first and second chakras, maybe your next step is astral projecting, maybe your next step is getting your shit together by quitting drugs, forgiving people who mistreated you in the past, maybe your next step is moving out of your parents house.
Maybe your next step is realizing that your thoughts and emotions which overwhelm you are NOT you.

Be well, be aware. The truth usually hurts for one moment, lies hurt forever.

>what you do exactly?
"See the thing - kill the thing - clean up the mess"
The thing is your mind/ego/painbody/Not-Self/whatever you want to call it. The thing is that which whispers to you "you're not good enough" or "you better play nice, you want everyone to like you." The thing you are trying to kill is the mental mind entity that does all it can to convince you that it is you.
(You) are not your mind. (You) have a mind, and it is a great tool when it is no longer trying to run your life or being used to make decisions.
I actively take control away from my mind and surrender to my form, my body, my inner truth. My only weapon is awareness. It was slow and cracked when I started my process, but now it is a well-honed tool, razor sharp, and I wield it without effort.
My little meme exaggerates my process of noticing thought and killing it, becoming so vehement in this process that I eventually went back to find the nest all these limiting beliefs were coming from and burned it all down at the source.

Thank you for the question

We have all heard of it but little is well known about it.
Soma, amrita, ambrosia, nectar of the gods, jade fluid, elixir of life, all the same name for the same "substance". It is said to taste sweet or like honey and instills some form of longevity in this life and immortality in the next.
But what do we actually know about it? A lot of people like to assign it to some ethnogenic substance because they want an excuse for their drug addictions, but actual texts about it seem to emphasize that it is gifted by the gods, or more likely produced within the body through some stage of spiritual cultivation.
In chinese cultivation it is known as " Jade Emperors Fluid" and is said to be produced in the saliva under the tongue and is a product of a highly developed individual. One having it is said to be a sign that they will live to their end of the naturally appointed life and not die early.

Please post whatever information you have about this substance because I know I have very little

The NAC Protocol (Updated December, 2022)

Morning

1200mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

600mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

600mg NAC
500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
100mg Pterostilbene
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

500mg Slo Niacin
100mg Pterostilbene
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

>Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

If your chosen oregano oil contains a higher amount of carvacrol (60mg+ per cap) you'll want to start with 1 cap morning, 1 cap night. If each cap contains less than 40mg, take 2 morning 2 night.

Cordyceps is popularized in the series, but the real life version, and most likely candidate for CNS takeover, is Cryptococcus. Let's get real for a moment.

It's already infecting brain cells (astrocytes, microglia) splicing genes and brute forcing our process, but eventually it will refine it's approach. Examples are brain lesions caused by reactive astrocytes and microglia. One of the features that make Multiple Sclerosis 'uncurable' is because the microglia no longer function to clear lesion debris and toxins. This is a connection that we've made that seems to go above the mainstream's head.

Astroglia have a direct relationship with neuron firing and can even be reprogrammed to be neurons. Cryptococcus has inserted itself into our thought process by infecting these glial cells and reprogramming their DNA.

You won't cure your issue unless you remove all sugar and carbs that's why it comes back


Following a keto diet affects your oral health by reducing plaque build-up. Eating sugar can feed the bacteria in your mouth that feeds on it and, along with tarter, becomes a film called plaque. The plaque will eat away at your enamel and irritate your gums, leading to oral problems down the line. While plaque may sound scary, everyone will deal with it in life.

Even healthy foods that are a part of a balanced diet, such as fruits and grains, contain sugar that affects bacteria and acid in your mouth. However, if you’re following a keto diet, you cut out almost all foods that contain enough sugar to feed bacteria. Carbs are mostly responsible for all of the sugars in your bloodstream and mouth. You’ll experience much less tooth erosion and decay if you aren’t eating sugars. Of course, you still need to brush and floss regularly to keep your mouth healthy, but it’s never wrong to reduce the factors that can harm you.

Less plaque also means fewer cavities. Sugars that stay on your teeth lead to dental decay. The bacteria that causes decay thrives in a sweet environment. Avoiding dietary sugars can reduce the likelihood of developing dental cavities. A low-carb diet without candy, sugary fruit, sugar-filled juices, baked goods, soda, and other similar foods/beverages can help to keep your mouth healthy. The ketogenic diet has high fat, lean meat, and limited carbs as part of their structure. There are practically no sugars in the diet, so it won’t form cavities.

posts.com:
NAC, Oregano Oil and Black Seed Oil have all been proven safe in clinical studies.

NAC has shown to be safe in human trials, even in high doses.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33326056/

Oregano was tested in human clinical trials (both Phase I & II) and found to be safe and non-toxic even at high doses.

See Section 4.1 Safety & Toxicty

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/fsn3.2994

See also a 2 month clinical trial on asthmatics.

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ptr.5967

Black Seed Oil and it's primary active Thymoquinone. See:

https://brieflands.com/articles/semj-76453.html

Orchestrated fear mongering over the extraction process making the compounds is unfounded.

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Vasfiye-Ozyurt/publication/329993761_Cold_press_in_oil_extraction_A_review/links/5c61d58792851c48a9cd3e63/Cold-press-in-oil-extraction-A-review.pdf

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A GCMS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

>Not wanting to kick Christian shins here, sorry if it feels like that. I've been studying comparative religions and philosophy for a long time, accepting everything but looking through and past them all..

It's smart to criticize literally everything that this reality offers.

Peribsen has done an excellent job of deciphering connections. There are reasons to be critical of religions, and I say that as someone who believes in a creator. The key to it all is connecting common convergence points between the stories of various Biblical texts to older and more ancient writings.

Discovering that parts of these various religions all connect to the same ancient stories don't discount a belief in creationism, it just refines it to a more pure form.

True history may have been obfuscated, but the keys to deciphering it are included everywhere. The interest in Tartaria threads show that people are thirsty for answers. The constant grind of politics and vaccines has turned many people away from mainstream and now they are seeking answers. We are just another circle of those seeking answers.

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
>Makes you wonder which that "God" is entrapping us in physicality but at the same time wanting to recycle us at its convenience...entrapping us in this Wheel...

I'm not a religious scholar by any means so take this with a grain of salt.

There is a strong displacement between the traditional Bible and the gnostics who came before it. The Bible features the creator God and the false god. It was thrown together to be 'canonical' and the parts that were disregarded were Gnostic.

But the gnostic texts held deeper questions about multiple realities, the demiurge and how we are recycled here. So we take pieces of all the various scrolls found and put together timelines and common stories.

The demiurge, matrix, reincarnation ... it's all connected imo. There are various excuses as to why we are reincarnated, various questions about the meaning of life. The common denominator is developing the ability to tap unfiltered knowledge so that you can answer these questions.

A Common theme for those who die and come back to life (NDE) is 'I knew everything'. But of course they don't bring it back with them because we are intentionally limited here.

Which is why expansion of consciousness is crucial to breaking free.

Fire signs have active and bright irises. Capricorn suns are emotionally reserved, and have pale skin, gaunt face and a low eye brow. This is true.

Psalm 91 is "the demon psalm" because it protects against dark forces.

Psalms 12, 14, and 32 are to be prayed across the year as they attract angelic forces. Psalm 45 can be added, and the 23rd at bedtime.

Note that in the KJV where you read "LORD" in all caps, that's usually where YHVH appears in the Hebrew. "Most high" is the translation for "Shaddai".

Where you read "selah", no one really knows what that means but it was probably where a musical interlude on a six-string harp was played. The pslams are actually hymns, and King David set them to music, which he was accomplished at. "Selah" doesn't need to be read, but you can pause there, or hum something you feel inspired to.

>>33992939
I think the term is called a "blind". They didn't want the general public to have access to their knowledge. Only people of their group or society should be "in the know". There were disputes back then, like against witches or the like, so it makes sense that they would keep hush hush in general, and they wouldn't want evil or rival mages to use their spells against them.

This even applies to Christianity. I think the book of Isaiah for example didn't used to be given to the masses (and going even older, the Bible wasn't for everyone to have, but certain leaders would read the Bible to their audience). I'm guessing that a lot of the mystical Christian/Jewish practices aren't considered by the stereotypical churchgoer because they were TOO hidden over time.

posts.com:
I speak Hebre on C1/C2 level so AMA.
Hebrew is an amazing language and I think it's great, but kabbalah is a peak of jewish thought, and in order to read kabbalistic texts freely you have to:
1) have a very good knowledge of biblical and mishnaic Hebrew, because most texts are written in rabbinic Hebrew - a mixture of those 2 which varies between different authors (it takes some time to adjust to the author or text, e.g. sepher yetzirah is quite easy, while Sepher Karnayim is quite difficult.
2) you need to understand Aramaic - Zohar and other minor books were written in Aramaic, and you need to know at least 100 most common verbs, and about 1000 most common nouns in order to understand most texts with the help of the dictionary in the pace that will keep you interested.
3) you need to know a lot about judaism. Most kabbalists had religious education equal to at least MA if not PhD in jewish theology, and they constantly quote the Talmud and other halakhic works. You need to learn things like halachot shabat or the impurity laws, you never know what will be quoted by someone you are reading.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34000083
4) also it's highly recommended that you learn how to read the bible according to one of the traditional recitations, I strongly recommend temani, it's hardest to learn, but it's also the most exotic and ancient.
5) At some point you should learn Israeli Hebrew - most people who read kabbalah are Hebrew native speakers, and most academic critical editions of kabbalistic writings are published in Hebrew.

>>34001815
You don't have "telepathy." You don't even know what it really is. "Telepathy", which is a pretty bad word for this phenomenon, has nothing to do with sending date invites or cute letters to your crush. Telepathy requires a state of complete nonattachment to the illusory world, and a solid center of Being. This instantly disqualifies you from possessing this ability in every conceivable way. What you are experiencing is a literal delusion.

Even the "mechanics" of this telepathy do not lend itself to be abused easily by profane and disturbed individuals like OP. It's not a Marvel superpower. Telepathy is synchronized perspective. Language and words no longer need to be spoken, for there is a union of understanding between two individuals. In normal interactions, a thought is formulated, converted into language, and then verbalized to another person. The other person, through receiving this information using language as a vessel, receives the other person's "perspective", or at least a fragment. And this force is in play when a person loses their train of thought, and then regains it once you put your maximum focus on their train of thought.

I tried experimenting with this with an ex-girlfriend. When we discovered this "telepathy" after taking LSD, we tried "empirically" testing it with playing cards. Except the very act of withholding information (in the form of a card that I am supposed to guess) from the person creates a barrier that prevents the synchronization, the "telepathy", from taking place. I do believe there are ways around this, but they are fairly advanced developments of this faculty, and OP sure as hell is nowhere remotely close to having developed it to the point of being able to ask someone to come over to his house.

I would tell you to seek help or treatment, but this post is so laughably absurd that not even the most qualified psychiatrist will know what to do with this level of deviancy.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

A christmas tree with lights on it, but it only has one ornament hanging from a low branch. A shiny golden ball. A bunch of soccer balls flying into a net. There is no goalie. I'd call it shooting drills, but there's too many at once. A solid gold necklace on someone's neck with about half a dozen or more glowing stones running through it. Someone kicking a vending machine in an attempt to get another can from it. One of those racks with cards on it, for different occasions that you rotate and pick a card from, then take upfront to buy. Someone picking up a box, they're a messenger, but they're shaking the box to hear what's inside. Someone lifting a barbell, it's hard to guess with how much weight because they aren't using the big weights, they're using a ton of small weights that add up to more, and they also don't have a spotter.
